2.83Z\"></path></svg></a>Setup Backend</h2>\n<p dir=\"auto\">{\n.env- Provide the following values:</p>\n<p dir=\"auto\">ALCHEMY_API_KEY=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</p>\n<p dir=\"auto\">PRIVATE_KEY=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</p>\n<p dir=\"auto\">POLYGON_API_KEY=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx\n}</p>\n<ol dir=\"auto\">\n<li>npx hardhat compile</li>\n<li>npx hardhat run scripts/deploy.js --network polygon_mumbai</li>\n<li>npx hardhat run scripts/verify.js --network mumbai( Verify the Game Collection contract first using the verify script by providing 4. the game collection address, later verify the Forger contract: Place the forger contract address and update the constructor argument with the game collection address.</li>\n</ol>\n<h2 tabindex=\"-1\" 0 2.83Z\"></path></svg></a>Setup Frontend</h2>\n<ol dir=\"auto\">\n<li>cd client</li>\n<li>npm install</li>\n<li>add a .env file with \"POLYGONSCAN_API_KEY\"</li>\n<li>run \"npm run dev\"</li>\n<li>Go to your browser at <a href=\"http://localhost:3000\" rel=\"nofollow\">http://localhost:3000</a></li>\n</ol>\n<h2 tabindex=\"-1\" dir=\"auto\"><a id=\"user-content-erc1155-concept---game-items\" Items</h2>\n<p dir=\"auto\">Based on the Deliverables, this ERC1155 contract will be implemented in the form of game items as it will be easier to visualize in this manner.</p>\n<ul dir=\"auto\">\n<li>Token 0-2 will be raw materials.</li>\n<li>Token 3-6 will be equipments.</li>\n</ul>\n<p dir=\"auto\">Sample Images of the Output:</p>\n<p dir=\"auto\"><a target=\"_blank\" alt=\"Screenshot 2023-12-08 200406\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"></a></p>\n<h2 tabindex=\"-1\" dir=\"auto\"><a id=\"user-content-deliverables\" class=\"anchor\" aria-hidden=\"true\" tabindex=\"-1\" href=\"#deliverables\"><svg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><path d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"></path></svg></a>Deliverables</h2>\n<p dir=\"auto\">Integrating with metamask is fairly simple, much of the work this week will be on the front-end design. Here is what needs to be accomplished by the end:</p>\n<p dir=\"auto\">There are three new concepts you must master:</p>\n<ol dir=\"auto\">\n<li>Creating that transactions that return instantly (such as from a view or pure function)</li>\n<li>Creating transactions that change the state of the blockchain and thus must be asynchronous. Dealing with an pending transactions is not trivial!</li>\n<li>Changing the network of metamask to the appropriate one</li>\n</ol>\n<p dir=\"auto\">You will build an ERC1155 token with a front-end. Here are the requirements:</p>\n<ul dir=\"auto\">\n<li>You must have a total of 7 tokens within the collection id [0-6]</li>\n<li>There is no supply limit for each token</li>\n<li>Anyone can mint tokens [0-2], but there is a 1-minute cooldown between mints. These are free to mint except for the gas cost.</li>\n<li>Token 3 can be minted by burning token 0 and 1.</li>\n<li>Token 4 can be minted by burning token 1 and 2</li>\n<li>Token 5 can be minted by burning 0 and 2</li>\n<li>Token 6 can be minted by burning 0, 1, and 2</li>\n<li>Tokens [3-6] cannot be forged into other tokens</li>\n<li>Tokens [3-6] can be burned but you get nothing back</li>\n<li>You can trade any token for [0-2] by hitting the trade this button.</li>\n<li>The process of burning and minting is called forging in this context.</li>\n<li>The webapp must tell the user how much matic they have (we will use the polygon network for cost savings)</li>\n<li>The webapp must tell the user how much of each token they have</li>\n<li>Provide a link to the OpenSea page somewhere</li>\n<li><b>Important</b> if the website detects someone is not on the polygon network, it must prompt them to change and autofill the feeds for changing the network (lesson on this later)</li>\n<li><b>Important</b> please use some styling on this website to make it look nice (bootstrap, tailwind CSS, etc). This is something you can show to future employers or business partners.</li>\n<li>You must use 2 separate contracts. One for the ERC1155 token, and one for the forging logic. The forging logic will need mint privileges.</li>\n</ul>\n</article>","renderedFileInfo":null,"shortPath":null,"tabSize":8,"topBannersInfo":{"overridingGlobalFundingFile":false,"globalPreferredFundingPath":null,"repoOwner":"Danishlynx","repoName":"metana_bootcamp","showInvalidCitationWarning":false,"citationHelpUrl":"https://docs.github.com/en/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/creating-a-repository-on-github/about-citation-files","showDependabotConfigurationBanner":null,"actionsOnboardingTip":null},"truncated":false,"viewable":true,"workflowRedirectUrl":null,"symbols":{"timed_out":false,"not_analyzed":false,"symbols":[{"name":"Build ERC1155 token with a Frontend","kind":"section_1","ident_start":2,"ident_end":37,"extent_start":0,"extent_end":4106,"fully_qualified_name":"Build ERC1155 token with a Frontend","ident_utf16":{"start":{"line_number":0,"utf16_col":2},"end":{"line_number":0,"utf16_col":37}},"extent_utf16":{"start":{"line_number":0,"utf16_col":0},"end":{"line_number":72,"utf16_col":0}}},{"name":"Setup Backend","kind":"section_2","ident_start":279,"ident_end":292,"extent_start":276,"extent_end":881,"fully_qualified_name":"Setup Backend","ident_utf16":{"start":{"line_number":6,"utf16_col":3},"end":{"line_number":6,"utf16_col":16}},"extent_utf16":{"start":{"line_number":6,"utf16_col":0},"end":{"line_number":22,"utf16_col":0}}},{"name":"Setup Frontend","kind":"section_2","ident_start":884,"ident_end":898,"extent_start":881,"extent_end":1042,"fully_qualified_name":"Setup Frontend","ident_utf16":{"start":{"line_number":22,"utf16_col":3},"end":{"line_number":22,"utf16_col":17}},"extent_utf16":{"start":{"line_number":22,"utf16_col":0},"end":{"line_number":29,"utf16_col":0}}},{"name":"ERC1155 Concept -
